INFP.description: INFPs are imaginative idealists guided by strong values. They seek harmony, appreciate beauty, and deeply understand others. Quietly passionate, they champion causes they believe in while maintaining a gentle, open-minded demeanor.

ENFP.description: ENFPs are energetic visionaries who love exploring possibilities. They inspire others with optimism and creativity. Highly social, they thrive on connections but may struggle with focus, always chasing new ideas.

INFJ.description: INFJs are rare, empathetic strategists with a knack for foresight. They advocate for change quietly but fiercely. Though reserved, they form deep bonds and pursue meaningful impact.

ENFJ.description: ENFJs are natural mentors who uplift others. Charismatic and responsible, they excel at motivating teams. They crave harmony and may neglect their own needs while caring for others.

INTJ.description: INTJs are logical architects of systems and ideas. They value competence, plan meticulously, and challenge norms. Reserved but confident, they pursue long-term goals with relentless focus.

ENTJ.description: ENTJs are bold leaders who thrive on efficiency. They organize people/resources to execute visions. Competitive and outspoken, they excel in crises but may overlook emotions.

INTP.description: INTPs are curious thinkers who dissect theories for fun. They love puzzles, debate principles, and resist routine. Absent-minded at times, they prioritize intellectual exploration over practicality.

ENTP.description: ENTPs are quick-witted brainstormers who challenge status quos. They generate ideas effortlessly but may struggle to finish projects. Playfully argumentative, they enjoy intellectual sparring.

ISTP.description: ISTPs are hands-on troubleshooters who live in the moment. Masters of tools/mechanics, they act calmly in crises. They resist constraints and prefer learning through action.

ESTP.description: ESTPs are thrill-seekers who thrive on spontaneity. Charming and resourceful, they think on their feet. They excel in sales or sports but may ignore long-term consequences.

ISFP.description: ISFPs are quiet artists who value authenticity. They express themselves through actions rather than words. Though easygoing, they fiercely protect their personal freedom and values.

ESFP.description: ESFPs are lively entertainers who love the spotlight. They bring fun to gatherings and focus on tangible experiences. Impulsive at times, they struggle with abstract planning.

ISTJ.description: ISTJs are dutiful organizers who uphold order. They follow rules, deliver on promises, and distrust flakiness. Meticulous and private, they excel in structured environments.

ESTJ.description: ESTJs are no-nonsense administrators who enforce systems. They value discipline, hierarchy, and practicality. While excellent at execution, they may dismiss unconventional ideas.

ISFJ.description: ISFJs are nurturing protectors who remember details others miss. They serve quietly, avoiding drama. Though humble, they’re the backbone of families/teams, ensuring stability.

ESFJ.description: ESFJs are harmonizers who prioritize others’ needs. They host gatherings, remember birthdays, and foster community. They struggle with criticism and crave appreciation for their efforts.
